Connect-Pfa2Array

OAuth2 Authentication

Perform OAuth2 based authentication to an array and get an access token

Syntax 

Connect-Pfa2Array -ApiClientName <String> [-ApiVersion <String>] -ClientId <String> [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Issuer <String> -KeyId <String> -PrivateKeyFile <String> [-PrivateKeyPassword <SecureString>] -Username <String> [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Credential <PSCredential>] [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] -Password <SecureString> [-Username <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Connect-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] -Credential <PSCredential> [-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging] -Endpoint <String> [-IgnoreCertificateError] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiClientName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and cannot be changed. true False None
-ApiVersion none alernative API version false False None
-ClientId none Client ID of the API client that issues the identity token. true False None
-Credential none The credentials for the FlashArray login false False None
-DisableVerbosePhoneHomeLogging none Disables Phonehome logging of Pure Storage PowerShell SDK activity on the FlashArray false False False
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address true False None
-IgnoreCertificateError none Prevents certificate errors such as an unknown certificate issuer or non-matching names from causing the request to fail. false False False
-Issuer none The name of the identity provider that will be issuing ID Tokens for this API client. This string represents the JWT iss (issuer) claim in ID Tokens issued for this API client. true False None
-KeyId none Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token. true False None
-Password none Password associated with the login name of the array user. true False None
-PrivateKeyFile none Local file path for the PEM encoded private key certificate. true False None
-PrivateKeyPassword none Password, if any, for the PEM encoded private key certificate. false False None
-Username none Login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system. true False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Credential $Cred -IgnoreCertificateError
Create a session with FlashArray using endpoint, and PSCredential
Example 2 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Username $ArrayUserName -ApiClientName $ApiClient.Name -Issuer $ApiClient.Issuer -ClientId $ApiClient.Id -KeyId $ApiClient.KeyId -PrivateKeyFile $PrivateKeyFile -PrivateKeyPassword $SecurePsw -IgnoreCertificateError
Create a session with FlashArray using API client name, issuer, API keyid and API client id. The API client can be created using New-Pfa2ApiClient
Example 3 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Username $ArrayUserName -ApiClientName $ApiClient.Name -Issuer $ApiClient.Issuer -ClientId $ApiClient.Id -KeyId $ApiClient.KeyId -PrivateKeyFile $PrivateKeyFile -PrivateKeyPassword $SecurePsw -ApiVersion $_ -IgnoreCertificateError
Create a session with FlashArray using a specific REST version with ApiVersion param
Example 4 
Connect-Pfa2Array -Endpoint $ArrayEndpoint -Username $ArrayUserName -Password $psw -IgnoreCertificateError -ApiVersion $Version
Create a session with the $TargetEndPoint using username $ArrayUserName and secure string password $psw. User ApiVersion to connect to specific REST version. The FlashArray authentication is cached for the duration of the PowerShell session. No -Array parameter is required for subsequent cmdlet for this PowerShell session

Top of page

Disconnect-Pfa2Array

Close OAuth2 Authentication

Close the connection to the array

Syntax 

Disconnect-Pfa2Array [-Array <Rest2Api>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Array none The FlashArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Disconnect-Pfa2Array -Array $Array
Disconnect a session with FlashArray

Top of page

Get-Pfa2Admin

List administrators

Displays a list of administrators.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Admin [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ExposeApiToken <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ExposeApiToken none If `true`, exposes the API token of the current user. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Admin -Array $Array
Get a list of administrators from FlashArray
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Admin -Array $Array | Where { $_.Name -eq $Name }
Get a list of array administrators and client filters the admins equal $Name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken

List API tokens

Displays API tokens for the specified administrators.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ExposeApiToken <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ExposeApiToken none If `true`, exposes the API token of the current user. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array
Get all administrators API token, API token is not exposed.
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -ExposeApiToken $True
Get array administrator's API token, API token of current admin is exposed.
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2AdminApiToken -Array $Array -Name $ArrayUsername
Get API token of array administrator whose name is $ArrayUsername

Top of page

Get-Pfa2AdminCache

List administrator cache entries

Displays entries in the administrator cache.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2AdminCache [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2AdminCache -Array $Array -Name $Admin.Name
Get admin cache for array admin $Admin.Name on FlashArray
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2AdminCache -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $Admin.Name }
Get all array administrators cache and client filter only $Admin.Name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2AdminSetting

List administrator settings

Displays the global administrator settings for the array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2AdminSetting [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array
Get global array admin setting

Top of page

Get-Pfa2Alert

List alerts

Displays a list of audit messages.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Alert [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Flagged <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Flagged none If set to `true`, lists only flagged messages. If set to `false`, lists only unflagged messages. if not specified, lists all messages. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array
Get all array alerts
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array -Flagged $True
Get all array alerts that are flagged
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array -Name $_.Name
Get array alert with name $_.Name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2AlertEvent

List alert events

Displays a list of alert events.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2AlertEvent [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Flagged <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Flagged none If set to `true`, lists only flagged messages. If set to `false`, lists only unflagged messages. if not specified, lists all messages. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but both cannot be set together. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2AlertEvent -Array $Array -Name $_.Name
Get array alert with name $_.Name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ApiClient

List API clients

Returns a list of API clients.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ApiClient [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ApiClient -Array $Array
Get API clients on FlashArray

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ApiVersion

List array supported Api information and PowerShell supported Api information

Displays array supported Api information and PowerShell supported Api information

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ApiVersion -Endpoint <String> [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Endpoint none The FlashArray name or IP address true False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • PureStorage.Rest.PureApiClientAuthInfo

Examples

Example 1 
PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}
{{ Add example description here }}

Top of page

Get-Pfa2App

List apps

Displays a list of installed apps.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2App [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2App -Array $testarray
Get all of apps in PureArray
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2App -Array $testarray -Name $app.Name
Get a specific app in PureArray by name

Top of page

Get-Pfa2AppNode

List app nodes

Displays a list of installed apps and their nodes.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2AppNode [-ApiVersion <String>] [-AppNames <List<String>>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-AppNames none The name of the installed app. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

  • System.Object

Get-Pfa2Array

List arrays

Displays a list of arrays.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance

List array front-end performance data

Displays real-time and historical front-end performance data at the array level including latency, bandwidth, IOPS, average I/O size, and queue depth.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <Int64>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <Int64>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`. false False None
-ProtocolGroup none Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance -Array $Array
Get array performance data
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2ArrayPerformance -Array $Array -StartTime $CurrentTimeAtYesterday -Endtime $CurrentTime -Resolution $ResolutionTime
Get array performance data starting from $CurrentTimeAtYesterday to $CurrentTime with a resolution of $ResolutionTime

Top of page

Get-Pfa2ArraySpace

List array space information

Displays real-time and historical array space information including unique volume and snapshot space, shared space, data reduction, provisioned capacity, usable capacity, and parity.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2ArraySpace [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <Int64>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <Int64>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-EndTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Resolution none The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None
-StartTime none Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified in milliseconds since the UNIX epoch. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2ArraySpace  -Array $Array
Get array space data
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2ArraySpace  -Array $Array -StartTime $CurrentTimeAtYesterday -Endtime $CurrentTime -Resolution $ResolutionTime
Get array space data starting from $CurrentTimeAtYesterday to $CurrentTime with a resolution of $ResolutionTime

Get-Pfa2Audit

List audits

Displays a list of audits.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Audit [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Audit -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Arguments.trim() -eq  $ProtectionGroupName }
Get audit of operations of which the argument is equal to $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2Connection

List volume connections

Displays a list of connections between a volume and its hosts and host groups, and the logical unit numbers (LUNs) used by the associated hosts to address these volumes.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-HostGroupNames <List<String>>] [-HostNames <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointNames <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-VolumeNames <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-HostGroupNames none Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupNames`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`). false False None
-HostNames none Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostNames`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`). false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-ProtocolEndpointNames none Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `pe01,pe02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointNames`) must be set to one name (e.g., `pe01`). false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None
-VolumeNames none Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeNames`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`). false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostNames $Host_.Name
Get connections the host $Host_.Name is related with
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array | Where { $_.Host.Name -eq $Host_.Name -and $_.Volume.Name -eq $Volume.Name }
Get all of connections and filter by connection host name and volume name
Example 3 
(Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostNames $Host_.Name).Volume
Get the volumes that host $Host_.Name connects with
Example 4 
Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostGroupNames $HostGroup.Name
Get connections the host group $HostGroup.Name is related with
Example 5 
(Get-Pfa2Connection -Array $Array -HostGroupNames $HostGroup.Name).Volume
Get the volumes that host group $HostGroup.Name connects with

Top of page

Get-Pfa2DirectoryService

List directory services configuration

Displays the role-based access control (RBAC) group configuration settings for manageability.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryService [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryService -Array $Array
Get directory service information of the FlashArray
Example 2 
(Get-Pfa2DirectoryService -Array $Array).Name
Get name list of all of directory services

Top of page

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole

List directory services roles

Displays the role-based access control (RBAC) group role settings.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-RoleNames <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-RoleNames none Performs the operation on the unique roles specified. For example, `array_admin`. Enter multiple roles in comma-separated format. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole -Array $Array -RoleNames $ArrayAdmin
Get directory service role information of the FlashArray by role name $ArrayAdmin
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole -Array $Array
Get information of all of directory service roles

Top of page

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest

List directory services test results

Displays the directory services test and displays the results. The test verifies that URIs can be resolved and that the array can bind and query the tree using the bind user credentials. The test also verifies that the array can find all configured groups to ensure the common names and group base are correctly configured.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] -Name <String> [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest -Array $Array -Name $Name
Test directory service named $Name

Get-Pfa2Host

List hosts

Returns a list of hosts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName
Get a host by name
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2Host -Array $Array | Where-Object{ $_.Name -eq $HostName }
Get all of hosts and filter by name $HostName
Example 3 
Get-Pfa2Host -Array $Array
Get all hosts from FlashArray

Get-Pfa2HostGroupHost

List host groups that are associated with hosts

Returns a list of host groups that are associated with hosts.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupNames <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberNames <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-GroupNames none Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-MemberNames none Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, and host groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostGroupHost -Array $Array -GroupNames $HostGroupName
Get all of hosts added to host group $HostGroupName

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance

List host group performance data

Returns real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes across all volumes, displayed both by host group and as a total across all host groups.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None

  • System.Object

Get performance data of host group $HostGroupName
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostGroupName }
Get performance data of all host groups and filter by host group name $HostGroupName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray

List host group performance data by array

Returns real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data returned is for each volume that is connected to a host group on the current array and for each volume that is connected to a host group on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array. The data is displayed as a total across all host groups on each array and by individual host group.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostGroupName }
Get performance data of all host groups by array and filter by host group name $HostGroupName

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostPerformance -Array $Array -Name $HostName
Get performance data of host $HostName
Example 2 
Get-Pfa2HostPerformance -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostName }
Get performance data of all hosts and filter by host name $HostName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray

List host performance data by array

Returns real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data returned is for each volume that is connected to a host on the current array and for each volume that is connected to a host on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array. The data is displayed as a total across all hosts on each array and by individual host.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray -Array $Array | Where-Object { $_.Name -eq $HostName }
Get performance data of all hosts by array and filter by host name $HostName

Top of page

Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup

List hosts that are members of protection groups

Displays a list of host members that belong to one or more protection groups.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupNames <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberNames <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-GroupNames none Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-MemberNames none Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, and host groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup -Array $Array -GroupNames $ProtectionGroupName
Get all of hosts that are added to protection group $ProtectionGroupName

Top of page

Syntax

If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None

-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Protocol none Protocol type. Valid values are `azure`, `google-cloud`, `nfs`, and `s3`. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Get-Pfa2Pod

List pods

Displays a list of pods that are stretched to this array.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2Pod [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `true`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `false`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in seconds. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Example 1

Get all PODs from FlashArray

Get-Pfa2PodArray

List pods and their the array members

Returns a list of pods and the local and remote arrays over which the pods are stretched. The optional `GroupNames` parameter represents the name of the pod. The optional `MemberNames` parameter represents the name of the array over which the pod is stretched.

Syntax 

Get-Pfa2PodArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupIds <List<String>>] [-GroupNames <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberIds <List<String>>] [-MemberNames <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Filter none Narrows down the results to only the response objects that satisfy the filter criteria. false False None
-GroupIds none A list of group IDs. false False None
-GroupNames none Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-Limit none Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size. false False None
-MemberIds none A list of member IDs. false False None
-MemberNames none Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, and host groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None
-Offset none The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned. false False None
-Sort none Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names as comma-separated values. false False None

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.
