Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTags

Delete tags

Deletes specified tags.

Syntax 

Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTags [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Keys <List<String>>] [-Namespaces <List<String>>] [-ResourceIds <List<String>>] [-ResourceNames <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Keys none A list of tag keys. false False None
-Namespaces none A list of namespaces. false False None
-ResourceIds none A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceIds` and `ResourceNames` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-ResourceNames none A list of resource names. The `ResourceIds` and `ResourceNames` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Remove-Pfa2VolumeSnapshotTags -Array $Array -Keys "Key2" -ResourceNames $Result.Name
Delete a tag with key "key2" on volume snapshot $Result.Name

Set-Pfa2AdminCache

Update or refresh entries in the administrator cache

Updates entries in the cache for administrators who currently do not have a cache entry, otherwise refreshes the existing entry.

Syntax

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Set-Pfa2AdminCache -Array $Array -Name $Admin.Name
Set admin cache for array admin $Admin.Name on FlashArray

Set-Pfa2Logging

Control logging to a named file.

Set logging of all Pure Storage PowerShell SDK activity to a file.

Syntax 

Set-Pfa2Logging [[-LogFilename] <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-LogFilename none Path to the file. Set to empty string or null to turn off logging. Logs will always be appended to the end of the file. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • PureStorage.Rest.PureApiClientAuthInfo

Examples

Example 1 
Set-Pfa2Logging -LogFilename $LogFilename
Set verbose logging to a file for this session

Update-Pfa2Admin

Modify an administrator

Modifies properties for the specified administrator.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Admin [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Locked <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-OldPassword <String>] [-Password <String>] [-PublicKey <String>] [-RoleName <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Locked none Returns a value of `true` if the user is currently locked out, otherwise `false`. Can be patched to `false` to unlock a user. This field is only visible to `array_admin` roles. For all other users, the value is always `null`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-OldPassword none The current password. false False None
-Password none Password associated with the account. false False None
-PublicKey none Public key for SSH access. false False None
-RoleName none Privilege level. Valid values include `array_admin`, `storage_admin`, and `readonly`. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}
{{ Add example description here }}

Top of page

Update-Pfa2AdminSetting

Modify administrator settings

Modifies the global administrator settings for the array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2AdminSetting [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-LockoutDuration <Int64>] [-MaxLoginAttempts <Int32>] [-MinPasswordLength <Int32>] [-SingleSignOnEnabled <Boolean>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-LockoutDuration none The lockout duration, in milliseconds, if a user is locked out after reaching the maximum number of login attempts. Ranges from 1 second to 90 days. false False None
-MaxLoginAttempts none Maximum number of failed login attempts allowed before the user is locked out. false False None
-MinPasswordLength none Minimum password length. If not specified, defaults to 1. false False None
-SingleSignOnEnabled none If `true`, then single sign-on is enabled for the array. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array -LockoutDuration 1000 -MaxLoginAttempts 3 -MinPasswordLength 10
Update global array admin setting. Lockout duration to 1000 secs, maximum login attempts to 3 and minimum password length to 10
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array -MaxLoginAttempts 2
Update global array admin setting. Maximum login attempts to only 2
Example 3 
Update-Pfa2AdminSetting -Array $Array -LockoutDuration 2000
Update global array admin setting. Lockout duration to 2000 seconds

Top of page

Modify flagged state

Modifies one or more alerts and display updated information about these alerts.

Update-Pfa2Alert [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Flagged <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Flagged none If set to `true`, the message is flagged. Important messages can can be flagged and listed separately. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Alert -Array $Array -Name $_.Name -Flagged $True

Update-Pfa2ApiClient

Manage an API client

Enables or disables an API client. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ApiClient [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none Returns a value of `true` if the API client is permitted to exchange ID tokens for access tokens. API clients are disabled by default. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2ApiClient -Array $Array -Enabled $True -Name $ClientName
Enable API client with name $ClientName

Update-Pfa2App

Modify app

Modifies an installed app or modifies Virtual Network Computing (VNC) access for apps that are being patched.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2App [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] -Name <String> [-VncEnabled <Boolean>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none If set to `true`, the app is enabled. By default, apps are disabled. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-VncEnabled none If set to `true`, VNC access is enabled. By default, VNC access is disabled. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2App -Array $testarray -Name $app.Name -Enabled $true
Find an app in PureArray by name and set it enabled

Top of page

Update-Pfa2Array

Modify an array

Modifies general array properties including the array name, login banner, idle timeout for management sessions, and NTP servers.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ArrayName <String>] [-Banner <String>] [-ConsoleLockEnabled <Boolean>] [-IdleTimeout <Int32>] [-NtpServers <List<String>>] [-ScsiTimeout <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-ArrayName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Banner none The welcome banner for the array. The banner is displayed on the GUI login screen and in the console login messages. false False None
-ConsoleLockEnabled none Enables or disables the console lock. When the lock is disabled the array allows root logins at the console. false False None
-IdleTimeout none Idle timeout in milliseconds. Valid values are `0` and any multiple of 60000 in the range of 300000 and 10800000. Any other values will be rounded down to the nearest multiple of 60000. false False None
-NtpServers none Alternate NTP servers, by IP address or hostname, assigned as the array source for reference time. Supersedes any previous NTP server assignments. false False None
-ScsiTimeout none The SCSI timeout. This value defaults to 60s if it is not specified. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Array -Array $Array -IdleTimeout $DisableIdleTimeout
Update FlashArray with a new idletimeout
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Array -Array $Array -ScsiTimeout $MinIdleTimeout
Update FlashArray with a new ScsiTimeout

Top of page

Top of page

Update-Pfa2DirectoryService

Modify directory services configuration

Modifies the directory service configuration.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryService [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-BaseDn <String>] [-BindPassword <String>] [-BindUser <String>] [-CaCertificate <String>] [-CheckPeer <Boolean>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Management <DirectoryServiceManagement>] -Name <String> [-Uris <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-BaseDn none Base of the Distinguished Name (DN) of the directory service groups. false False None
-BindPassword none Masked password used to query the directory. false False None
-BindUser none Username used to query the directory. false False None
-CaCertificate none The certificate of the Certificate Authority (CA) that signed the certificates of the directory servers, which is used to validate the authenticity of the configured servers. false False None
-CheckPeer none Whether or not server authenticity is enforced when a certificate is provided. false False None
-Enabled none Whether or not the directory service is enabled. false False None
-Management none Properties specific to the management service. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. true True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Uris none List of URIs for the configured directory servers. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2DirectoryService -Array $Array -Name $response.Name -BindUser $bindUser -BindPassword $bindPassword -BaseDN $baseDN -URIS $DSUri
Find directory service by name $response.Name and update with the new values ofBindUser, BindPassword, BaseDN, and URIS

Top of page

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole

Modify directory services roles

Modifies directory services roles, mapping them to their configured `group` and `group_base` in the directory service.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Group <String>] [-GroupBase <String>] -RoleNames <List<String>> [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Group none Common Name (CN) of the directory service group that contains users with the authority level of the specified role name. false False None
-GroupBase none Specifies where the configured group is located in the directory tree. false False None
-RoleNames none Performs the operation on the unique roles specified. For example, `array_admin`. Enter multiple roles in comma-separated format. true False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole -Array $Array -RoleNames $ArrayAdmin -Group $Group -GroupBase $GroupBase
Find directory service role by role name $ArrayAdmin and update with new values of Group and GroupBase

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None

-Nameservers none List of DNS server IP addresses. false False None

Outputs

Update-Pfa2Hardware

Modify visual identification

Modifies the visual identification of a specified hardware component, and causing that component's ID LED to turn on or off.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Hardware [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-IdentifyEnabled <Boolean>] [-Index <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-IdentifyEnabled none State of an LED used to visually identify the component. false False None
-Index none Number that identifies the relative position of a hardware component within the array. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}
{{ Add example description here }}

Update-Pfa2Host

Manage a host

Manages an existing host, including its storage network addresses, CHAP, host personality, and preferred arrays, or associate a host to a host group. The `Name` query parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Host [-AddIqns <List<String>>] [-AddNqns <List<String>>] [-AddWwns <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Chap <Chap>] [-HostGroupName <String>] [-HostName <String>] [-Iqns <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqns <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArrays <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[PureStorage.FlashArray.Rest.Model.Reference]>] [-RemoveIqns <List<String>>] [-RemoveNqns <List<String>>] [-RemoveWwns <List<String>>] [-Wwns <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AddIqns none Adds the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-AddNqns none Adds the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-AddWwns none Adds the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) to those already associated with the specified host. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Chap none Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). false False None
-HostGroupName none The host group to which the host should be associated. false False None
-HostName none The new name for the resource. false False None
-Iqns none The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Nqns none The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host. false False None
-Personality none Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set. false False None
-PreferredArrays none For synchronous replication configurations, sets a host's preferred array to specify which array exposes active/optimized paths to that host. Enter multiple preferred arrays in comma-separated format. If a preferred array is set for a host, then the other arrays in the same pod will expose active/non-optimized paths to that host. If the host is in a host group, `preferred_arrays` cannot be set because host groups have their own preferred arrays. On a preferred array of a certain host, all the paths on all the ports (for both the primary and secondary controllers) are set up as A/O (active/optimized) paths, while on a non-preferred array, all the paths are A/N (Active/Non-optimized) paths. false False None
-RemoveIqns none Disassociates the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) from the specified host. false False None
-RemoveNqns none Disassociates the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) from the specified host. false False None
-RemoveWwns none Disassociates the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) from the specified host. false False None
-Wwns none The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName -iqns $iqns -Chap $newChap
Find a host named $HostName and update its values of Name, iqns, and Chap
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Host -Array $Array -Name $HostName -HostGroupName $HostGroupName
Find a host named $HostName and update its host group.

Top of page

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-HostGroupName none The new name for the resource. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None

Update-Pfa2Kmip

-CaCertificate none The text of the CA certificate for the KMIP server. false False None
-CertificateName none The certificate used to verify FlashArray authenticity to the KMIP servers. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Uris none List of URIs for the configured KMIP servers. false False None

Update-Pfa2Pod

Modify a pod

Modifies pod details.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Pod [-AbortQuiesce <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FailoverPreferences <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[PureStorage.FlashArray.Rest.Model.Reference]>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Mediator <String>] [-Name <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PromoteFrom <String>] [-Quiesce <Boolean>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-SkipQuiesce <Boolean>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-AbortQuiesce none Set to `true` to promote the pod when the `pod-replica-link` is in the `quiescing` state and abort when waiting for the `pod-replica-link` to complete the quiescing operation. false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `true`, the pod has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `time_remaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed pod is permanently eradicated. A pod can only be destroyed if it is empty, so before destroying a pod, ensure all volumes and protection groups inside the pod have been either moved out of the pod or destroyed. A stretched pod cannot be destroyed unless you unstretch it first. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed pod can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the pod is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-FailoverPreferences none Determines which array within a stretched pod should be given priority to stay online should the arrays ever lose contact with each other. The current array and any peer arrays that are connected to the current array for synchronous replication can be added to a pod for failover preference. By default, `failover_preferences=null`, meaning no arrays have been configured for failover preference. Enter multiple arrays in comma-separated format. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Mediator none Sets the URL of the mediator for this pod, replacing the URL of the current mediator. By default, the Pure1 Cloud Mediator (`purestorage`) serves as the mediator. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-PodName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-PromoteFrom none The `undo-demote` pod that should be used to promote the pod. After the pod has been promoted, it will have the same data as the `undo-demote` pod and the `undo-demote` pod will be eradicated. false False None
-Quiesce none Set to `true` to demote the pod after the `pod-replica-link` goes into `quiesced` state and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This ensures that all local data has been replicated to the remote pod before the pod is demoted. false False None
-RequestedPromotionState none Patch `requested_promotion_state` to `demoted` to demote the pod so that it can be used as a link target for continuous replication between pods. Demoted pods do not accept write requests, and a destroyed version of the pod with `undo-demote` appended to the pod name is created on the array with the state of the pod when it was in the promoted state. Patch `requested_promotion_state` to `promoted` to start the process of promoting the pod. The `promotion_status` indicates when the pod has been successfully promoted. Promoted pods stop incorporating replicated data from the source pod and start accepting write requests. The replication process does not stop when the source pod continues replicating data to the pod. The space consumed by the unique replicated data is tracked by the `space.journal` field of the pod. false False None
-SkipQuiesce none Set to `true` to demote the pod without quiescing the `pod-replica-link` and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This stops all pending replication to the remote pod. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Pod -Array $TargetArray -Name $RemotePodName -Destroyed $true
Destroy a remote pod with name $RemotePodName (This is not eradicated)
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Pod -Array $TargetArray -Name $RemotePod.Name -RequestedPromotionState "demoted"
Demote a remote POD with name $RemotePod.Name on FlashArray
Example 3 
Update-Pfa2Pod -Array $Array -Name $Pod.Name -Destroyed $True -ErrorAction Stop
Destroy a POD $Pod.Name. Assert if there is an error. (POD is not eradicated, see Remove-Pfa2Pod)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink

Modify pod replica links

Modifies pod replica links. The `LocalPodNames` and `RemotePodNames` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-LocalPodIds <List<String>>] [-LocalPodNames <List<String>>] [-Paused <Boolean>] [-RemoteIds <List<String>>] [-RemoteNames <List<String>>] [-RemotePodIds <List<String>>] [-RemotePodNames <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `names` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-LocalPodIds none A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodNames` query parameter. false False None
-LocalPodNames none A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodIds` query parameter. false False None
-Paused none Returns a value of `true` if the replica link is to be created in a `paused` state. Returns a value of `false` if the replica link is to be created not in a `paused` state. If not specified, defaults to `false`. false False None
-RemoteIds none A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteNames` query parameter. false False None
-RemoteNames none A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteIds` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodIds none A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodNames` query parameter. false False None
-RemotePodNames none A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodIds` query parameter. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink -Array $Array -LocalPodNames $LocalPodName -RemotePodNames $RemotePodName -Paused $True
Update the POD replica link status to paused where local pod names is $LocalPodName and remote pod names is $RemotePodName

Top of page

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup

Manage a protection group

Configures the protection group schedules to generate and replicate snapshots to another array or to an external storage system. Also renames or destroys a protection group.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupName <String>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackout <TimeWindow>] [-SnapshotSchedule <SnapshotSchedule>] [-SourceRetention <RetentionPolicy>] [-TargetRetention <RetentionPolicy>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Has this protection group been destroyed? To destroy a protection group, patch to `true`. To recover a destroyed protection group, patch to `false`. If not specified, defaults to `false`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-ReplicationScheduleBlackout none The schedule of a replication action. false False None
-SnapshotSchedule none The schedule settings for protection group snapshots. false False None
-SourceRetention none The retention policy for the source array of the protection group. false False None
-TargetRetention none The retention policy for the target(s) of the protection group. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $ProtectionGroupName -ProtectionGroupName $NewProtectionGroupName
Update the name of protection group from $ProtectionGroupName to $NewProtectionGroupName
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Destroyed $true -Name $NewProtectionGroupName
Destroy the protection group with name $NewProtectionGroupname (This is not Eradicated)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot

Modify a protection group snapshot

Modifies a protection group snapshot so that it can be destroyed. To destroy a protection group snapshot, set `destroyed=true`. To recover a protection group snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `destroyed=false`. The `Name` parameter is required.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `true` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `time_remaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $SnapshotName -Destroyed $true
Destroy a protection group snapshot named $SnapshotName
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $DefaultSnapshotName -ProtectionGroupSnapshotName $NewSnapshotName
Update a protection group snapshot name to $NewSnapshotName from $DefaultSnapshotName

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget

Manage a protection group target

Allows or disallows the source array to replicate protection group data to the target array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-Allowed <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-GroupNames <List<String>>] [-MemberNames <List<String>>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-Allowed none If set to `true`, the target array has allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target array. If set to `false`, the target array has not allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target. target-protection-group false False None
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-GroupNames none Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`. false False None
-MemberNames none Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, and host groups. Enter multiple names in comma-separated format. For example, `vol01,vol02`. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
# Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget -Array $Array -GroupNames $RemotePGName -MemberNames "nfstarget" -Allowed $False
Disallowing a target in a protection group is not supported for offload targets

Top of page

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup

Manage a remote protection group

Configures the snapshot retention schedule of a remote protection group. Also destroys a remote protection group from the offload target. Before the remote protection group can be destroyed, the offload target must first be removed from the protection group via the source array. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-TargetRetention <RetentionPolicy>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `true` if the remote protection group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `time_remaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed remote protection group is permanently eradicated. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed remote protection group can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the remote protection group is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None
-TargetRetention none The retention policy for the remote protection group. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $RemotePGName -On "nfstarget" -Destroyed $True
Destroy the remote protection group $RemotePGName on the offload target "nfstarget"
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup -Array $Array -Name $RemotePGName -On "nfstarget" -TargetRetention $policy
Update retention policy for offload target "nfstarget" for protection group $RemotePGName on FlashArray (See New-Pfa2RetentionPolicyObject)

Top of page

Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot

Manage a remote protection group

Destroys a remote protection group snapshot from the offload target. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `ids` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.

Syntax

Parameters

-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `true`, destroys a resource. Once set to `true`, the `time_remaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-On none Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

Update-Pfa2SmiS

Modify SLP and SMI-S

Modifies the Service Location Protocol (SLP) and the SMI-S provider, enabling or disabling them.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2SmiS [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-SlpEnabled <Boolean>] [-WbemHttpsEnabled <Boolean>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-SlpEnabled none If set to `true`, the Service Location Protocol (SLP) and its ports, TCP 427 and UDP 427, are enabled. false False None
-WbemHttpsEnabled none If set to `true`, the SMI-S provider and its port, TCP 5989 is enabled. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2SmiS -array $Array -WbemHttpsEnabled $false -SlpEnabled $false
Update SMI-S by disabling WbemHttps and Slp

Update-Pfa2Subnet

Modify subnet

Modifies one or more specified subnet properties.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Subnet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Gateway <String>] [-Mtu <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Prefix <String>] [-SubnetName <String>] [-Vlan <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Enabled none Returns a value of `true` if subnet is enabled. Returns a value of `false` if subnet is disabled. If not specified, defaults to `true`. false False None
-Gateway none The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the gateway through which the specified subnet is to communicate with the network. false False None
-Mtu none Maximum message transfer unit (packet) size for the subnet in bytes. MTU setting cannot exceed the MTU of the corresponding physical interface. If not specified, defaults to `1500`. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Prefix none The IPv4 or IPv6 address to be associated with the specified subnet. false False None
-SubnetName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None
-Vlan none VLAN ID number. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Subnet -Array $Array -Name $Name -Enabled $false -Vlan $Vlan
Find a subnet of FlashArray by name and update with specific parameters

Top of page

Update-Pfa2Support

Create connection path

Creates a connection path from the array to another array.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Support [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-PhonehomeEnabled <Boolean>] [-Proxy <String>] [-RemoteAssistActive <Boolean>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-PhonehomeEnabled none The status of phonehome. If set to `true`, enable phonehome. If set to `false`, disable phonehome. false False None
-Proxy none The value of the current proxy, which is used for connecting to cloud services such as phonehome, remote assist, etc. Specify the server name, including the scheme and proxy port number. false False None
-RemoteAssistActive none The status of a remote assist session. If set to `true`, enable the remote assist session. If set to `false`, disable the remote assist session. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • None

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Support -array $Array -PhonehomeEnabled $false -Proxy $proxy -RemoteAssistActive $false
Update a connection path by setting values of Proxy, PhonehomeEnabled, and RemoteAssistActive

Top of page

Update-Pfa2Volume

Update a volume

Updates a volume by renaming, destroying, or resizing it, or by updating its limits or pod or volume group membership.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2Volume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Pod <Reference>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-Qos <Qos>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroup <Reference>] [-VolumeName <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `true`, destroys a resource. Once set to `true`, the `time_remaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Pod none Moves the volume into the specified pod. false False None
-Provisioned none Updates the virtual size of the volume. Measured in bytes. false False None
-Qos none Sets QoS limits. false False None
-RequestedPromotionState none Valid values are `promoted` and `demoted`. Patch `requested_promotion_state` to `demoted` to demote the volume so that the volume stops accepting write requests. Patch `requested_promotion_state` to `promoted` to promote the volume so that the volume starts accepting write requests. false False None
-Truncate none If set to `true`, reduces the size of a volume during a volume resize operation. When a volume is truncated, Purity automatically takes an undo snapshot, providing a 24-hour window during which the previous contents can be retrieved. After truncating a volume, its provisioned size can be subsequently increased, but the data in truncated sectors cannot be retrieved. If set to `false` or not set at all and the volume is being reduced in size, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `provisioned` parameter is set to a volume size that is smaller than the original size. false False None
-VolumeGroup none Adds the volume to the specified volume group. false False None
-VolumeName none The new name for the resource. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Destroyed $True -Name $vol.Name
Destroy a volume $vol.Name on FlashArray (Volume is not Eradicated, see Remove-Pfa2Volume)
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $_.Name -VolumeGroup $VolGroupRef
Remove a reference between volume $_.Name and volume group $VolGroupRef (See New-Pfa2ReferenceObject for creating a $VolGroupRef)
Example 3 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name -Provisioned $NewSize -Truncate $True
Truncate a volume provisioned size on FlashArray
Example 4 
Update-Pfa2Volume -Array $Array -Name $Volume.Name -Provisioned $NewSize
Expand a volume provisioned size on FlashArray

Top of page

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup

Manage a volume group

Renames, destroys, or sets the QoS limits for the volume group. To rename a volume group, set `Name` to the new name. To destroy a volume group, set `destroyed=true`. To recover a volume group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `destroyed=false`. Sets the bandwidth and IOPs limits of a volume group through the respective `BandwidthLimit` and `IopsLimit` parameter. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Qos <Qos>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none Returns a value of `true` if the volume group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `time_remaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed volume group is permanently eradicated. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed volume group can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the volume group is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-Qos none Qos bandwidth false False None
-VolumeGroupName none A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Name $VolGroup.name -Destroyed $True
Destroy a volume group $VolGroup.Name. (Volume group is not eradicated, see Remove-Pfa2VolumeGroup)
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup -Array $Array -Qos $qos -Name $VolumeGroup.Name
Find a volume group named $VolumeGroup.Name and update its Qos. Qos object could be created from New-Pfa2QosObject

Top of page

Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot

Manage a volume snapshot

Rename, destroy, or recover a volume snapshot. To rename the suffix of a volume snapshot, set `name` to the new suffix name. To recover a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `destroyed=true`. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

Syntax 

Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Ids <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-VolumeSnapshotName <String>] [<CommonParameters>]

Parameters

Name Alias Description Required? Pipeline Input Default Value
-ApiVersion none alternative API version false False None
-Array none The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet. false False None
-Destroyed none If set to `true`, destroys a resource. Once set to `true`, the `time_remaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `destroyed=false`. Once the `time_remaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered. false False None
-Ids none Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs in comma-separated format. The `Ids` and `Name` parameters cannot be provided together. false False None
-Name none Performs the operation on the unique name specified. false True (ByPropertyName, ByValue) None
-VolumeSnapshotName none The new name for the resource. false False None

Inputs

The input type is the type of the objects that you can pipe to the cmdlet.

  • System.String

Outputs

The output type is the type of the objects that the cmdlet emits.

  • System.Object

Examples

Example 1 
Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot -Array $Array -Name $VolumeSnapshot.Name -VolumeSnapshotName $NewSuffix
Update a volume snapshot name to $NewSuffix on FlashArray
Example 2 
Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot -Array $Array -Destroyed $True -Name $VolumeSnapshot.Name
Destroy a volume snapshot for snapshot $VolumeSnapshot.Name

Top of page
